column3: Sodium can refer to the chemical element with the symbol Na. In another context, it refers to a common table salt.
column4: Sodium is an essential element found in many foods and is necessary for human health.
column5: The chef used sodium to enhance the flavor of the dish.

column3: Deer refers to the animal, whereas dear sounds similar and is used as a term of endearment or reference to someone cherished.
column4: The deer grazed peacefully in the meadow during the early morning.
column5: My dear friend called me to share some exciting news.

column3: Sucked can mean being drawn into something forcefully, like air or liquid, or in the context of sexual implications.
column4: The vacuum cleaner sucked up all the dirt from the floor.
column5: He felt sucked into the intense rivalry at work, which created a toxic atmosphere.

column3: Triggered can refer to the activation of a firearm or the emotional response someone has to certain topics or situations.
column4: The teacher triggered the fire alarm as a drill practice for the students.
column5: She felt triggered by the memories of her childhood trauma during the discussion.
